name: Shopify
title: AI as Baseline Expectation — Prove AI Can't Do It

classification.classificationRationale: Validated Model 3 (Embedded Teams) with Contextual orientation. CEO Lütke's mandate ('prove AI can't do it before hiring') makes AI proficiency a condition of employment and resource allocation. No separate AI lab — AI tools embedded into every role. Contextual: individuals balance AI-assisted and traditional work within their roles. Strong Model 6c (Grassroots) elements as CEO mandate formalizes what employees were already doing.

description:
Shopify represents one of the clearest examples of contextual ambidexterity: CEO Tobi Lütke mandated that employees must 'show jobs can't be done by artificial intelligence before asking for more headcount and resources.' Rather than creating a separate AI lab, Shopify embedded AI capability expectations into every role — making AI proficiency a condition of employment and resource allocation.

AI usage is now a 'baseline expectation' that influences performance reviews. Lütke expects employees to use AI as 'a thought partner, deep researcher, critic, tutor, or pair programmer.' Developers have access to Copilot, Cursor, and Claude Code 'all pre-tooled and ready to go.' AI integration is formally part of monthly business reviews and product development cycles.

The approach extends to products: Shopify Magic and Sidekick externalize this AI-first philosophy to merchants. The Winter 2025 'RenAIssance edition' contained 150+ AI-focused product updates. By Winter 2026, Shopify introduced 'Agentic Storefronts' — making every store agent-ready by default. Headcount dropped from 8,300 to 8,100 over the past year while output increased.

mechanisms.name: Put Executives on the Tools

openQuestions: How is the 'prove AI can't do it' mandate enforced in practice — what evidence is required?
Has Shopify's headcount reduction been primarily in AI-replaceable roles?
How do Shopify's merchants respond to the AI-first product strategy?
taxonomyFeedback: Shopify's 'prove AI can't do it' mandate is the strongest articulation of contextual ambidexterity in the herbarium. Could serve as a reference example for Contextual orientation.
The boundary between Model 3 (Embedded) and Model 6c (Grassroots) is blurred here — the CEO mandate formalizes what may have been emerging grassroots AI adoption.
